adrFormatAddress: 1201 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10065-7402, USA

editorialSummary.text: Laid-back restaurant offering hot & cold sandwiches, plus breakfast & homestyle BBQ cooking.

originalText.text: Foods are simple but delicious, coffee is nothing special but the cheese pocket is to die for. Other foods are also delicious .The place is nice and clean . Workers are always with smile.

text.text: Foods are simple but delicious, coffee is nothing special but the cheese pocket is to die for. Other foods are also delicious .The place is nice and clean . Workers are always with smile.

originalText.text: We had such a great experience at Veritable on the UES! The staff was so friendly and attentive and Tony made us feel right at home. He had great recommendations based on what we like. First, we tried the hot meals and they were delicious. The Brisket specifically was one of the best I’ve had. We also tried the salmon which was so fresh and delicious. The ingredients are made fresh daily and you can tell! For sides, we tried the Mac and cheese and the quinoa, which We would highly recommend. The highlight of our meal came when we tried the rainbow stuffed cookies. We will be back very soon!

The ingredients are made fresh daily and you can tell! For sides, we tried the Mac and cheese and the quinoa, which We would highly recommend. The highlight of our meal came when we tried the rainbow stuffed cookies. We will be back very soon!

originalText.text: Last time I was here I raved about the everything flat bagel w/ cream cheese and lox, today they sampled a lavender honey latte… it was amazing flavorful and not too sweet.

text.text: Last time I was here I raved about the everything flat bagel w/ cream cheese and lox, today they sampled a lavender honey latte… it was amazing flavorful and not too sweet.

originalText.text:
Love the food (particularly the breakfast omlete) and it has solid coffee.

Management:
Please review your listing on Uber Eats. Coffee options, you can't choose whole milk or half and half. Required to pay for an extra topping on omletes right now. Worth reviewing all the food and drink items.

originalText.text: Food wasn’t anything special, seasoned correctly and presented adequately. Coffees are executed well and pastry’s and sides are on point. The only concern are the old beverages. On more than one occasion the lemonade tastes off. Working in the food industry there are limits as to how long fresh juices can be reused. Mixing new lemonade with old definitely does not mask the taste of spoiled lemonade. Besides this all the other food passes. The portions are definitely what you are paying for, LES standards. Register Staff isn’t friendly or warm just solely there for what they applied for (work). The staff that prepares the food and serves are also very dry, not too accommodating when it comes to your order. I’m assuming most people that enter this establishment are aware they will be charged for everything extra they are adding. This however leaves in question as to why staff doesn’t measure up to the prices the location is charging?? Never been one to bargain for food or it’s pricing but that also includes the service, no? It’s understandable that royalty treatment is not necessary but basic etiquette is. Mr.Tony Tertiropoulos please go over your staff training with Celeste Pancho. Your food is adequate, but service is to be questionable.
